snippet: As many Republicans soften their stance on social issues, including same-sex marriage and immigration, the only issue truly uniting the party is a commitment to shrinking government.
abstract: Political Memo; as many Republicans soften their stance on social issues, fearful of losing voters, only issue truly uniting whole party is commitment to shrinking government; trend explains why Speaker John A Boehner has judged that it is better to take economic and political risks associated with automatic spending cuts than seek compromise with Pres Obama over budget dispute.
lead_paragraph: As many Republicans soften their stance on social issues, including same-sex marriage and immigration, the only issue truly uniting the party is a commitment to shrinking government.

headline.seo: G.O.P., Lacking Unity, Clings to Budget Goals
headline.main: G.O.P. Clings to One Thing It Agrees On: Spending Cuts
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Clings to One Thing It Agrees On: Spending Cuts
